intro: Guatteria dolichopoda, commonly known as the long-fruited guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that mature to a yellowish color, containing several seeds. Guatteria dolichopoda is often found in lowland rainforests and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
